unnormalised: **Telecommunications: Fiber-to-Home Expansion Gains Momentum in India**
normalised: **Telecommunications: Fiber-to-Home Expansion Gains Momentum in India**

unnormalised: New Delhi – Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel continue aggressive expansion of their Fiber-to-Home (FTTH) networks across India. Recent reports indicate JioFiber has extended its reach to over 1,600 cities, while Airtel Xstream Fiber is rapidly catching up, focusing particularly on Tier-II and Tier-III towns.
normalised: New Delhi – Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel continue aggressive expansion of their Fiber-to-Home (F T T H) networks across India. Recent reports indicate JioFiber has extended its reach to over one thousand six hundred cities, while Airtel Xstream Fiber is rapidly catching up, focusing particularly on Tier-II and Tier-III towns.

unnormalised: Dr. S. Ramanathan, a telecom analyst at IIM Bangalore, notes the increasing demand for high-speed internet, fuelled by the rise of OTT platforms and work-from-home arrangements. "Consumers are demanding seamless connectivity for everything from streaming Bollywood movies to attending crucial virtual meetings."
normalised: Doctor S. Ramanathan, a telecom analyst at I I M Bangalore, notes the increasing demand for high-speed internet, fuelled by the rise of O T T platforms and work-from-home arrangements. "Consumers are demanding seamless connectivity for everything from streaming Bollywood movies to attending crucial virtual meetings."

unnormalised: The expansion includes laying thousands of km of optical fiber cable. Jio recently announced investments of Rs. 5,000 crore to further enhance its FTTH infrastructure in Uttar Pradesh. Airtel is focusing on bundling services, offering packages including internet, landline, and entertainment subscriptions. This has led to fierce competition, benefiting consumers with more affordable plans. Some developers are even offering free 1 year FTTH subscriptions for buyers of new apartments with 1200 sq ft area. The increased bandwidth is expected to boost the digital economy and support initiatives like Digital India.
normalised: The expansion includes laying thousands of kilometer of optical fiber cable. Jio recently announced investments of rupee five thousand crore to further enhance its F T T H infrastructure in Uttar Pradesh. Airtel is focusing on bundling services, offering packages including internet, landline, and entertainment subscriptions. This has led to fierce competition, benefiting consumers with more affordable plans. Some developers are even offering free one year F T T H subscriptions for buyers of new apartments with one thousand two hundred square feet area. The increased bandwidth is expected to boost the digital economy and support initiatives like Digital India.
